plugins.name: Modyo Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
The Modyo Figma Plugin is an essential tool for designers working within the Dynamic Framework. This plugin streamlines your design-to-development workflow with three core functionalities:


Export CSS as Variables: Seamlessly export your design elements as CSS variables tailored for the Dynamic Framework. This feature ensures consistency and speeds up the handoff process, making it easier for developers to implement designs directly from Figma.


Generate Color Palette: Effortlessly create and customize color palettes directly within Figma. This feature allows you to generate a range of colors that can be easily adjusted and applied across your design system, ensuring brand consistency and flexibility.


Font Size Generator Based on PX: Simplify your typography management with a font size generator that operates based on pixel values. This allows for easy creation of a typographic scale that aligns with your design requirements, ensuring responsive and visually appealing text styles.


The Modyo Figma Plugin is designed to empower designers and developers, making collaboration smoother and more efficient by providing a unified toolkit for creating consistent and high-quality UI components.
plugins.tagline: A plugin for Dynamic Framework

plugins.name: FigML - Figma XML Exporter Plugin
plugins.description:
FigML - Figma XML Exporter Plugin


Export your Figma designs to clean, structured XML. This lets you work with any programming language, any framework, and fit the code perfectly into your existing codebase. No tokens, no API calls, no headaches.


What You Get


🔍 Output That Actual Humans (and Robots) Can Read

- Preserves your Figma structure exactly as designed

- Strips away the noise: default properties and design-time clutter


🎮 Plays Nice With Everything

- Generate fresh components from scratch

- Update existing components when designs inevitably change

- Audit your component library against the latest design updates

- Create components that fit perfectly into your existing architecture

- Works with whatever you're using: React, SwiftUI, Flutter, WPF, Qt, shadcn/ui, DaisyUI, or that custom framework your team built


👑 You're the Boss

Feed the XML to any AI assistant (ChatGPT, Claude, Cursor, etc.) and get exactly the code you need. No cookie-cutter templates, no assumptions about how you like to work.


How It Works


1. Design in Figma (you're already doing this)

2. Click export (literally one click)

3. Ask your AI buddy to convert the XML

4. Ship it


Ready to stop fighting with design-to-code tools? Install FigML.


Learn more at www.figml.pro

accepted.name: FigML
accepted.description: Export Figma design to XML. Simple. Clean. Powerful.

plugins.tagline: Export Figma design to XML. Simple. Clean. Powerful.

plugins.name: Data Bloom
plugins.description:
Data Bloom is your go-to plugin for breathing life into your Figma designs. Easily replace generic dummy text with real-looking, localized content and user data tailored to your audience. Now supporting 10 languages with 10+ data type options (see below), Data Bloom will continue expanding to include more languages and data types.


Supported languages:

🇦🇿 Azerbaijani, 🇺🇸 English (USA), 🇩🇪 German, 🇰🇿 Kazakh, 🇰🇬 Kyrgyz, 🇷🇺 Russian, 🇹🇷 Turkish, 🇹🇲 Turkmen, 🇺🇦 Ukrainian, 🇺🇿 Uzbek


Available data types:

🎲 Random: Generates a data point by randomly selecting from any of the other available data types.

👫🏻 Names: Creates realistic first names, last names, or full names, with options for gender.

🤪 Playful Usernames: Produces fun and quirky usernames, optionally starting with an "@" symbol.

📞 Phone Numbers: Generates phone numbers with various formatting options, including country-specific domestic styles.

💳 Payment card details: Helps to generate mock payment card information, such as Card numbers, Expiry date and CVV/CVC

⭐️ Ratings and reviews: Generate localized generic review text from categories like "General", "Product specific" or "App feedback"

📆 Date: Creates date values with customizable formats and selectable year ranges, including custom inputs.

📆 Days of the week: Inserts day names (e.g., Monday, Tuesday)

📆 Months: Populates layers with month names (e.g., January, February)

💼 Professions: Populates layers with a diverse list of job titles and occupations.

🎨 Colors: Replaces selected text layers with common color names.


Whether you’re designing a prototype or building a demo, Data Bloom makes it effortless to populate text layers in seconds, ensuring your prototypes feel authentic, personalized, and polished.


✦ Lightning-fast generation

✦ Realistic, localized data (Names, Phone Numbers, Colors, Usernames and Professions)

✦ Lightweight and Figma-friendly

✦ Continuous updates with new languages and data types


Replace “lorem ipsum” forever — grow your designs with Data Bloom.


🌱 How-to Guide:

  1. Run the Data Bloom plugin.
  2. Select one or multiple text layers in your design where you want to insert random data.
  3. Choose a preferred data language and data type from the list.
  4. Click “Generate Data” and the plugin will instantly populate the selected text layers based on your set preferences.

Sharing design files, prototypes, and experiments 🚀

plugins.tagline: Replace dummy text with real-world localized content (🇦🇿 🇺🇸 🇰🇿 🇰🇬 🇹🇷 🇹🇲 🇺🇿 +3)

plugins.name: Text Styles to Variables
plugins.description:
PLUGIN CRAFTED FOR REFOKUS


Plugin Documentation

This plugin extracts font-related properties from your local text styles and converts them into reusable variables. It automatically applies the following variables:

•Font size

•Font weight

•Font family


Additionally, the plugin documents—but does not apply—the following properties:

•Line height

•Letter spacing


This is due to a current Figma limitation: dynamic variables for these properties are not yet supported. As a workaround, these values are stored as string variables for documentation purposes only.


For example:

If the original line-height is 100%, the plugin will store it as a variable with:

variableName: 100%, variableValue: 1em (calculated as 100 ÷ 100 × 1em)


Naming Convention for text styles:


To ensure accurate detection and conversion, your text styles should follow this naming structure:

•Use the prefix title- followed by a number (e.g., title-1) for headings

•Use the prefix text- followed by a number (e.g., text-2) for paragraphs


You can also use suffixes to describe combo classes. For instance:

•text-2-buttonLabel


This will still be recognized as a text-2 style with additional contextual information.
plugins.tagline: By Fede Luna

135683.name: Text Styles to Variables
135683.description:

Plugin Documentation

To ensure accurate detection and conversion, your text styles should follow this naming structure:

•Use the prefix text- followed by a number (e.g., text-2) for paragraphs


You can also use suffixes to describe combo classes. For instance:

•text-2-buttonLabel


This will still be recognized as a text-2 style with additional contextual information.

plugins.name: Link Spacing & Radius Variables (Alpha)
plugins.description:
One-click application of variables to selected objects


Important: Variable Requirements

1. Variables must be in an external library (local variables are not supported yet)

2. The library must be connected to your file


Variable Naming Requirements:

For Spacing:

- Format: `space-{number}`

- Examples: `space-4`, `space-8`, `space-16`, `space-24`

- Variable value must match the number in the name

For Radius:

- Format: `radius-{number}`

- Examples: `radius-4`, `radius-8`, `radius-16`

- Variable value must match the number in the name


Collection Requirements:

- Spacing collection must include the word "spacing" in its name

- Radius collection must include the word "radius" or "border-radius" in its name


How to Prepare Your File

1. Connect the variable library:

- Open "Team Library" menu

- Find the required library

- Enable the toggle next to the "Variables" section

2. Ensure objects are prepared:

- For spacing: objects must use Auto Layout

- For radius: objects must support the cornerRadius property


How to Use

1. Select objects you want to apply variables to

2. Launch the plugin

3. Choose the desired collection from the dropdown (marked with 📚 icon)

4. Click "Apply spacing" or "Apply radius"
plugins.tagline: Link spacing and radius variables

plugins.name: Design Feedback Lite
plugins.description: Instantly review selected frames using core UX principles. Get structured feedback, radar scoring, and real-time insights — all powered by design psychology.
plugins.tagline: Instant UX feedback on your designs — backed by psychology.

126473.name: Design Feedback Lite
126473.description: Instantly review selected frames using core UX principles. Get structured feedback, radar scoring, and real-time insights — all powered by design psychology.
126473.release_notes:
✨ Viewport-aware analysis: Mobile and desktop designs now get context-appropriate feedback.

⚠️ Contrast issues now tiered: Low, medium, and high severity for better prioritization.

💡 Smart Mode improved: Skips system layers like status bars, navs, and menu bars.

🧠 Accessibility standard toggle: Choose between WCAG 2.1 AA and AAA.

🎯 Refined touch and text size rules: Based on device context and layer type.

🎨 Sleek new UI: Modern layout, grouped controls, and better legibility.

Small plugin. Big feedback. Smarter than ever.
126473.tagline: Instant UX feedback on your designs — backed by psychology.

plugins.name: Stockpress
plugins.description:
About

Welcome to the Stockpress plugin for Figma, where you can quickly find and add files from your Stockpress workspace to your Figma designs. Once ready, export Frames and images back to Stockpress - complete with Frame URLs for easy access to working files!


What is Stockpress?

Stockpress is a refreshingly simple Digital Asset Management system–for everyone. One centralized workspace to add, organize, collaborate on, and share files with unlimited users and teams.


How to get started:

  1. First, sign up for a Stockpress workspace (get started for free!)
  2. Upload or import your files and folders to get organized
  3. Install the Stockpress plugin for Figma and connect your account
  4. Easily add files from Stockpress to your Figma designs
  5. Export Frames, images, and/or Frame URLs back to Stockpress


For help, contact us through your in-workspace chat or email us at help@stockpress.co
plugins.tagline: Add files from your Stockpress workspace to your design and export Figma assets back once ready

How to get started:

  2. Upload or import your files and folders to get organized
  3. Install the Stockpress plugin for Figma and connect your account

136760.tagline: Add files from your Stockpress workspace to your design and export Figma assets back once ready

plugins.name: SmartTableFill
plugins.description:
SmartTableFill is a GPT-powered plugin designed for intelligent table population with contextual data. Unlike basic data fillers, SmartTableFill analyzes existing content to generate relevant entries, making it ideal for tasks like: creating email addresses based on user names, generating addresses aligned with specified cities, or calculating percentages based on given numbers.


Choose between basic and contextual modes to quickly populate tables for mockups, prototyping, and presentations. Customizable settings allow you to target specific text nodes, saving time on manual entry and bringing a smarter approach to data generation.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly populate tables with smart, contextual data using GPT

110927.name: SmartTableFill
110927.description:
SmartTableFill is a GPT-powered plugin designed for intelligent table population with contextual data. Unlike basic data fillers, SmartTableFill analyzes existing content to generate relevant entries, making it ideal for tasks like: creating email addresses based on user names, generating addresses aligned with specified cities, or calculating percentages based on given numbers.


Choose between basic and contextual modes to quickly populate tables for mockups, prototyping, and presentations. Customizable settings allow you to target specific text nodes, saving time on manual entry and bringing a smarter approach to data generation.

110927.tagline: Effortlessly populate tables with smart, contextual data using GPT

plugins.name: Text With Styles
plugins.description:
# Flutter Text Style Inspector


A powerful Figma plugin that bridges the gap between Figma text styles and Flutter's Material Design text theme system. This plugin helps developers and designers maintain consistency between Figma designs and Flutter implementations by automatically mapping Figma text styles to their corresponding Flutter TextTheme properties.


## Features


### Real-time Style Inspection

- Instantly view text style information for any selected text layer

- Live updates as you select different text elements

- Support for multiple text selection with smart duplicate filtering


### Comprehensive Style Information

- Displays the complete Figma text style name

- Shows associated color token information

- Previews the actual text content

- Automatically generates corresponding Flutter TextTheme code


### Smart Flutter Code Generation

- Automatically maps Figma text styles to Flutter's Material Design text theme

- Supports all standard Material text styles:

- Headlines (Large, Medium, Small)

- Titles (Large, Medium, Small)

- Body text (with weight variations)

- Labels (Large, Medium, Small)

- Includes font weight handling for body styles (w400, w500, w600)


### User-Friendly Interface

- Clean, organized display of style information

- Easy-to-copy Flutter code snippets

- Compact, floating UI that stays out of your way

- Simple click-outside-to-close functionality


## How to Use


1. Select any text layer(s) in your Figma design

2. The plugin will automatically display:

- The applied Figma text style

- The color token (if available)

- A preview of the text content

- The equivalent Flutter TextTheme code

3. Copy the generated Flutter code directly into your application


## Best Practices


- Name your Figma text styles to match Material Design conventions for automatic mapping

- Use consistent style names to ensure accurate Flutter code generation

- Apply color styles to text layers for complete token information

- Select multiple text layers to quickly inspect all text styles in a component


Perfect for teams working with both Figma and Flutter, this plugin streamlines the handoff process and ensures design consistency across platforms.
plugins.tagline: Select any layer and get its texts with styles

plugins.name: Inkblot Notes
plugins.description:
Inkblot Notes by Inkblot

Turn notes from Inkblot sessions into sticky notes in FigJam


New to Inkblot? See how you can simplify your research studies


How it works

1. Enter a session ID

2. Once submitted, all notes from the session are imported and organized by author and session time

You can import notes from multiple sessions into a single FigJam file

plugins.name: Easy Select
plugins.description:
Easy Select helps you expedite the tedious and repetitive selection workflows with handy 1-click shortcuts.


-> Simply select one item, then:

  1. Select its parent / children / siblings
  2. Select others with the same color, name, size, rotation ...


-> Or, select a few items, then:

  1. Filter down to those with a particular type, name...


-> Save your carefully curated selections as bookmarks for reuse.


-> Restore from a list of historical selections.


For questions or feedback, please email easy-select@smarter.town.
plugins.tagline: The all-in-one selection helper

plugins.name: Behind the frame
plugins.description:
Опис﻿ание

Случаются ситуации, когда объекты оказываются за фреймами и вы не знаете какие из них. Как бы вы их не нашли, при большом количестве фреймов поместить их в нужный в панели слоев не самое простое занятие, а вынести за пределы и снова внутрь не гарантирует поместить на тоже место. Этот плагин упрощает это действие.


Select all out-of-frame objects

Selects all objects that are out of frames.


Objects in frames

Places all selected objects in the frames above them.

  1. Select the objects along with the frames and run the script.
  2. All selected objects will end up in the frames they visually match.


Выбрать всё вне фреймов

Выбирает все объекты которые находятся вне фреймов.


Объекты во фреймы

Помещает все выделенные объекты во фреймы над которыми находятся.

  1. Выделите объекты вместе с фреймами и запустите скрипт.
  2. Все выделенные объекты окажутся во фреймах с которыми совпадают визуально.
plugins.tagline: In order to place objects that are behind frames into frames

81981.name: Behind the frame
81981.description:
Опис﻿ание

Feel free to use this plugin for any concepts/artwork.

plugins.name: Ting-Image
plugins.description:
Ting Image—One-click compression, instant format conversion. Switch between PNG, JPEG, WEBP, AVIF for smaller, optimized images. Efficiency meets ease!

1. Efficient Compression

Advanced algorithms reduce image size while preserving quality, saving storage and speeding up load times.

2. Multi-Format Conversion

Instantly switch between PNG, JPEG, WEBP, and AVIF formats to fit any design or development need.

3. Batch Processing

Process multiple images at once to save time and boost productivity.

4. Smart Preview

Real-time previews let you compare and control compression quality effortlessly.

5. Seamless Integration

Works directly within Figma, keeping your design workflow smooth and uninterrupted.

6. Lightweight & Stable

Runs efficiently without slowing down Figma, ensuring a seamless experience.


Thank you for your support

@Wiley Shaw @v-huanghaolan
plugins.tagline: Export PNG, JPEG, WEBP, AVIF,

plugins.name: Set Gradient Style
plugins.description:
The plugin allows you to transfer the parameters of a new gradient to previously published styles, simplifying the process of manually transferring angles and breakpoints. This may be necessary if you need to update the current style, but doing it manually will cause.


  1. Select a Frame, Rectangle or Vector with a new gradient
  2. Write local style name which you want to update
  3. Press "Set style"

plugins.name: Notes
plugins.description:
Notes is a Figma plugin designed to streamline collaboration between designers, project managers, and engineers. It enhances the design handoff process by providing a structured way to document and share feedback directly within Figma. Whether you're annotating designs, adding development notes, or organizing project details, Notes ensures seamless communication and clarity across teams.

With Notes, design handoff becomes more efficient, reducing miscommunication and making it easier for teams to align on project goals.

plugins.name: Content Kit
plugins.description: his Figma plugin allows designers to quickly generate Nigerian-themed content directly within their projects, saving time and enhancing local relevance. The plugin includes customizable templates, authentic text content (e.g., Yoruba proverbs, Pidgin phrases, or local idioms), cultural icons, and elements inspired by Nigeria’s rich diversity. Whether designing for digital products, branding, or social media, the plugin ensures an authentic touch, fostering deeper connections with Nigerian audiences. Users can tweak settings to suit various languages, regions, and styles, making it a versatile tool for creative professionals.

plugins.name: Pancake Work
plugins.description:
Guideline (Vietnamese):

  1. Plugin giúp link figma design vào một issue của Pancake Work
  2. Các bước thực hiện:


  1. Vào Pancake Work copy link issue
  2. Chọn node cần gắn link, chú ý đánh dấu ready for dev cho node đó trước (nếu cần) (node nên là frame/section)
  3. Mở plugin Pancake Work, paste link issue vào ô đầu tiên (Plugin có lưu lại link với mỗi node)
  4. Click vào ô thứ 2, nhấn Cmd + L (với Mac), hoặc Ctrl + L (với Windows) để lấy link figma, rồi paste
  5. Nhấn Create/Update


Roadmap:

  1. Update English guideline
  2. Listen feedback from Pancake designers to improve
  3. Maybe link for Kanban
  4. Hmmm, I don't know...


Copyright 2024 Pancake
plugins.tagline: Link Figma designs to Pancake Work

130564.name: Pancake Work
130564.description:
Guideline (Vietnamese):

  1. Plugin giúp link figma design vào một issue của Pancake Work
  2. Các bước thực hiện:


  1. Vào Pancake Work copy link issue
  2. Chọn node cần gắn link, chú ý đánh dấu ready for dev cho node đó trước (nếu cần) (node nên là frame/section)
  3. Mở plugin Pancake Work, paste link issue vào ô đầu tiên (Plugin có lưu lại link với mỗi node)
  4. Click vào ô thứ 2, nhấn Cmd + L (với Mac), hoặc Ctrl + L (với Windows) để lấy link figma, rồi paste
  5. Nhấn Create/Update


Roadmap:

  1. Update English guideline
  2. Listen feedback from Pancake designers to improve
  3. Maybe link for Kanban
  4. Hmmm, I don't know...


Copyright 2024 Pancake

networkAccess.reasoning: We need to access the Pancake Work api, Google Fonts

130564.tagline: Link Figma designs to Pancake Work

plugins.name: Toggle Visibility By Type
plugins.description:
Toggle Visibility by Type is designed to streamline your design workflow by allowing you to quickly toggle the visibility of selected layers based on their type.

Whether you’re working with 🖼️ images, 📝 text, 🔲 shapes, 🔗 paths, ↔️ lines, 📁 groups, or 📐 frames, this plugin provides an intuitive interface to control which elements are visible in your design. Simply select the layers or groups you want to modify, choose the layer type you want to toggle, and hit the ☑️ button.


This plugin is especially useful for managing complex designs and improving your efficiency in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly toggle visibility of selected layers by type!

99518.name: Toggle Visibility By Type
99518.description:

Whether you’re working with 🖼️ images, 📝 text, 🔲 shapes, 🔗 paths, ↔️ lines, 📁 groups, or 📐 frames, this plugin provides an intuitive interface to control which elements are visible in your design. Simply select the layers or groups you want to modify, choose the layer type you want to toggle, and hit the ☑️ button.


This plugin is especially useful for managing complex designs and improving your efficiency in Figma.
99518.tagline: Quickly toggle visibility of selected layers by type!

plugins.name: ex-portable
plugins.description:
Ex-portable is a super simple plug-in for Figma that allows you to pull export settings from a main component in a library to an instance. That’s all.


Get settings for selected instances

Select the instances you want to apply the export settings from a main component in a library for, and select this command.


Get settings for all instances

Got a lot of instances on your page? Select this command to apply export settings from their main components.
plugins.tagline: Port your export settings from component to instance.

97644.name: ex-portable
97644.description:

Get settings for all instances

Got a lot of instances on your page? Select this command to apply export settings from their main components.
97644.tagline: Port your export settings from component to instance.

plugins.name: Translate
plugins.description: Translate
plugins.tagline: Translate

plugins.name: Easily Name output
plugins.description:
Step 1: Export Name Mapping


Prefix the node name with "▼". For example: "▼page-template".

Enter the Google Sheet URL in the first input field or click the file button to select a file.

The number of nodes must match the number of rows in the uploaded document (excluding the title).

The name mapping should be in the first column, with the column header named "Name".

Specify the corresponding sheet name.

If an XLSX file is selected, the first sheet will be prefilled.

Step 2: Export


Select the nodes to be exported.

If none are selected, all nodes on the current page starting with "▼" will be exported.

Choose the export format (PDF/PNG/JPG/SVG).
plugins.tagline: Replace Export Names for Figma Frame Types

92594.name: Easily Name output
92594.description:
Step 1: Export Name Mapping


Prefix the node name with "▼". For example: "▼page-template".

Enter the Google Sheet URL in the first input field or click the file button to select a file.

The number of nodes must match the number of rows in the uploaded document (excluding the title).

The name mapping should be in the first column, with the column header named "Name".

Specify the corresponding sheet name.

If an XLSX file is selected, the first sheet will be prefilled.

Step 2: Export


Select the nodes to be exported.

If none are selected, all nodes on the current page starting with "▼" will be exported.

Choose the export format (PDF/PNG/JPG/SVG).
92594.tagline: Replace Export Names for Figma Frame Types

plugins.name: Import CSS shadows, create Figma styles
plugins.description:
I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.


You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

accepted.name: Luis Ouriach
accepted.description:
Design & community @figmadesign. I write a newsletter, manage and host @8pxmag. 

Hot sauce on everything.

plugins.tagline: Copy, paste, generate

135698.description:
I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.


You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

plugins.name: PRE: AI Design Review
plugins.description:
PRE helps designers and product teams understand how users will interact with their UI designs — before a single line of code is written.


🔹 Select any frame in Figma and click “Upload Selected Frame” to send it to PRE.

🔹 PRE will automatically generate a heatmap, predict click-through rates, and provide UX suggestions using AI.

🔹 You can modify the generated tags, draw additional clickable elements, or toggle the heatmap overlay on and off using the second button in the top bar.

🔹 Once you're happy with the predictions, you can download the heatmap and click data for further analysis or presentation.


Whether you're working on early wireframes or high-fidelity mocks, PRE helps you make design decisions backed by predictive user analytics — all from right inside Figma.


Powered by PRE
plugins.tagline: Export any Figma frame and instantly generate heatmaps, CTR predictions and UX feedback with PRE.

138599.name: PRE: AI Design Review
138599.description:
PRE helps designers and product teams understand how users will interact with their UI designs — before a single line of code is written.


🔹 Select any frame in Figma and click “Upload Selected Frame” to send it to PRE.

🔹 PRE will automatically generate a heatmap, predict click-through rates, and provide UX suggestions using AI.

🔹 You can modify the generated tags, draw additional clickable elements, or toggle the heatmap overlay on and off using the second button in the top bar.

🔹 Once you're happy with the predictions, you can download the heatmap and click data for further analysis or presentation.


Whether you're working on early wireframes or high-fidelity mocks, PRE helps you make design decisions backed by predictive user analytics — all from right inside Figma.


Powered by PRE
138599.tagline: Export any Figma frame and instantly generate heatmaps, CTR predictions and UX feedback with PRE.

plugins.name: Fillio - Elevate design with dynamic content
plugins.description:
Fillio - Less Typing, More Designing


Fillio is the simplest way to populate your Figma designs with realistic {{placeholder}} content. Whether you’re working on wireframes, prototypes, invoices, brand books, or daily UI design, Fillio saves you time by instantly filling your artboards with dynamic content.



Key Features:


Quick & Easy Filling:

Fill your designs with placeholders like names, addresses, and all type of contents in a single click.


Customizable Placeholders:

Use simple tags like {{name}} or {{Date}} to create dynamic content that fits your design.


Efficient Workflow:

Skip the tedious task of manually adding content—let Fillio do the heavy lifting.


Perfect for Prototypes & Wireframes:

Make your designs look polished even in early stages, without all the manual effort.



How it Works:


  1. Install Fillio from the Figma Community.
  2. Select the elements or frames where you want to add placeholders.
  3. Define Your Placeholders using simple tags like {{name}} or {{Type}}.
  4. Click “Submit”, and Fillio automatically adds content to your design.



Get Started with Fillio Today!

accepted.name: Mohammed M.Akasha
accepted.description: A User-centered Designer who crafts meaningful products through design.

plugins.tagline: Less Filling.. More designing.

128098.name: Fillio - Elevate design with dynamic content

How it Works:


  1. Install Fillio from the Figma Community.
  2. Select the elements or frames where you want to add placeholders.
  3. Define Your Placeholders using simple tags like {{name}} or {{Type}}.
  4. Click “Submit”, and Fillio automatically adds content to your design.



Get Started with Fillio Today!

plugins.name: Text Filler with CSV
plugins.description:
You can populate components containing multiple text elements with strings from a CSV file.

Tab-separated values are also supported, allowing copy-paste directly from Google Spreadsheet.

Rows and columns are applied in layer order, and empty cells are skipped.


複数のテキストを含むコンポーネントに CSV から文字列を流し込むことができます。

タブ区切りにも対応し、Google Spreadsheet からのコピペも対応しています。

行や列は、レイヤー順に適用され、空のセルはスキップされます。


解説記事： https://note.com/feb19/n/n17ac26f980e0
plugins.tagline: Populate components with multiple text fields from CSV automatically. 複数テキストを持つコンポーネントに文字列を自動入力できます。

行や列は、レイヤー順に適用され、空のセルはスキップされます。

plugins.name: Color Extractor
plugins.description: A Figma plugin that quickly detects the dominant color of the selected image layer and automatically adds it as a new fill to the layer. Perfect for designers who need to extract and use the main color in their layouts, palettes, or backgrounds.
plugins.tagline: Detect and add the dominant color of an image to your layer fills with one click.

120795.name: Color Extractor
120795.description: A Figma plugin that quickly detects the dominant color of the selected image layer and automatically adds it as a new fill to the layer. Perfect for designers who need to extract and use the main color in their layouts, palettes, or backgrounds.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin requires access to Figma's CDN to retrieve and process images used in the selected layers.

120795.tagline: Detect and add the dominant color of an image to your layer fills with one click.
